newsitem.title: USA: SEC, NASD have no comment on bond executive's fine.
newsitem.headline: SEC, NASD have no comment on bond executive's fine.

text.p: Federal officials said Monday they have no comment on penalties paid by municipal bond underwriter Calvin Grigsby, who was fined by California regulators last week for political contribution reporting violations.

"We don't confirm or deny possible ongoing investigations," said a representative of the National Association of Securities Dealers, when asked about a $5,000 fine Grigsby paid to the California Fair Political Practices Commission.

A Securities and Exchange Commission representative also had no comment about the fine paid by Grigsby, president of Grigsby Brandford & Co., Inc., one of the largest African American-owned municipal bond underwriters in the U.S.

Christopher Taylor, executive director of the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board, an industry regulatory panel in Washington, said he did not know if SEC or NASD are examining Grigsby's contributions.
MSRB rules are approved by the SEC.

Taylor said the board's rule G-37, which curbs political contributions by bond firms to elected municipal officials, would not apply to the $53,500 in contributions made by Grigsby and entities he controlled in 1993.
That is because the rule did not take effect until April 1994, Taylor said.
But Taylor said pre-1994 contributions activity may be covered by longstanding MSRB rule G-17, which requires bond firms to deal fairly and ethically with muni bond customers.
He said MSRB notified bond dealers in 1993, when rule G-37 was proposed but not yet finalized, that their contributions could be covered by rule G-17 in the interim.

The California commission said last week that Grigsby made contributions totalling $11,500 in the first half of 1993. It also said Fiscal Funding Co., Inc. and other entities controlled by Grigsby made campaign contributions totaling $42,000.

The panel said Grigsby and Fiscal Funding failed to file timely major donor campaign statements reporting the contributions. Grigsby is a 50 percent owner and controlling partner of Fiscal Funding, an equipment leasing company.
